name: LoggingWinston
overview:
This class allows you interact with Stackdriver Logging through Winston.

First, install @google-cloud/logging-winston with npm:

$ npm install --save @google-cloud/logging-winston

If you are running your app on Google Compute Engine, you won't need to worry about supplying connection configuration options to @google-cloud/logging-winstonâ€” we figure that out for you.

However, if you're running your app elsewhere, you will need to provide project details to authenticate API requests.

Google Cloud Platform

var logging-winston = require('@google-cloud/logging-winston')();

Elsewhere

var logging-winston = require('@google-cloud/logging-winston')({ projectId: 'grape-spaceship-123', keyFilename: '/path/to/keyfile.json' });

The full set of options which can be passed to @google-cloud/logging-winston are outlined in our Authentication guide.

methods.name: LoggingWinston
methods.description: This module provides support for streaming your winston logs to Stackdriver Logging.

params.name: options
params.description: • Configuration object. Refer to this link for authentication information.

params.name: options.level
params.description: • The default log level. Winston will filter messages with a severity lower than this.

params.name: options.levels
params.description: • Custom logging levels as supported by winston. This list is used to translate your log level to the Stackdriver Logging level. Each property should have an integer value between 0 (most severe) and 7 (least severe). If you are passing a list of levels to your winston logger, you should provide the same list here.

params.name: options.inspectMetadata
params.description: • Serialize winston-provided log metadata using util.inspect. Default: false

params.name: options.logName
params.description: • The name of the log that will receive messages written to this transport. Default: winston_log

params.name: options.resource
params.description: • The monitored resource that the transport corresponds to. On Google Cloud Platform, this is detected automatically, but you may optionally specify a specific monitored resource. For more information see the official documentation.

params.name: options.serviceContext
params.description: • For logged errors, we provide this as the service context. For more information see this guide">https://cloud.google.com/error-reporting/docs/formatting-error-messages} and the official documentation.

params.name: options.serviceContext.service
params.description: • An identifier of the service, such as the name of the executable, job, or Google App Engine service name.

methods.name: getCurrentTraceFromAgent
methods.description: Gets the current fully qualified trace ID when available from the

methods.name: log
methods.description: Relay a log entry to the logging agent. This is normally called by winston.

params.name: levelName
params.description: • The severity level at which this entry is being logged. This should match one of the levels provided to the constructor which defaults to npm levels. This level will be translated to the appropriate Stackdriver logging severity level.

params.name: metadata
params.description: • Winston-provided metadata that should be attached to the log entry. If a httpRequest property is set, it will be treated as a HttpRequest request log message. If options.inspectMetadata is set, we will convert the remaining properties to strings before reporting.

params.name: callback
params.description: • A callback that is invoked when the logging agent either succeeds or gives up writing the log entry to the remote server.
